etymologies: Middle English: shortening of Old French escale, from the Germanic base of scale

definitions: each of the small, thin horny or bony plates protecting the skin of fish and reptiles, typically overlapping one another.
shortDefinitions: each of small plates protecting skin of fish and reptiles

definitions: a thick, dry flake of skin.
shortDefinitions: thick dry flake of skin

definitions: a rudimentary leaf, feather, or bract.
shortDefinitions: rudimentary leaf or bract

definitions: each of numerous microscopic structures covering the wings of butterflies and moths.
shortDefinitions: each of numerous microscopic structures covering wings of butterflies

definitions: a flaky covering or deposit.
shortDefinitions: flaky deposit

definitions: a white deposit formed in a kettle, boiler, etc. by the evaporation of water containing lime

examples.text: banging sounds emanating from the boiler may be caused by a buildup of scale

shortDefinitions: white deposit formed in kettle, boiler

definitions: tartar formed on teeth.
shortDefinitions: tartar formed on teeth

definitions: a coating of oxide formed on heated metal

examples.text: a spray-on chemical for removing welding scale and heat discoloration from stainless steel

shortDefinitions: coating of oxide formed on heated metal

definitions: remove scale or scales from

examples.text: he scales the fish and removes the innards

shortDefinitions: remove scale or scales from

definitions: remove tartar from (teeth) by scraping them

examples.text: dental hygienists give treatment such as scaling and polishing teeth

shortDefinitions: remove tartar from teeth by scraping them

definitions: (especially of the skin) form scales

examples.text: the skin may scale and peel away with itching, stinging, or burning sensations in the infected area

shortDefinitions: form scales

definitions: come off in scales or thin pieces; flake off

examples.text: the paint was scaling from the brick walls

shortDefinitions: come off in scales or thin pieces

etymologies: Middle English (in the sense ‘drinking cup’, surviving in South African English): from Old Norse skál ‘bowl’, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch schaal, German Schale ‘bowl’, also to English dialect shale ‘dish’

definitions: an instrument for weighing, originally a simple balance (a pair of scales) but now usually a device with an electronic or other internal weighing mechanism

examples.text: bathroom scales
kitchen scales

shortDefinitions: instrument for weighing

definitions: either of the dishes on a simple balance.
shortDefinitions: either of dishes on simple balance

definitions: the zodiacal sign or constellation Libra.
shortDefinitions: zodiacal sign or constellation Libra

definitions: a large drinking container for beer or other alcoholic drink.
shortDefinitions: large drinking container for beer

definitions: weigh a specified weight

examples.text: some men scaled less than ninety pounds

shortDefinitions: weigh specified weight

etymologies: late Middle English: from Latin scala ‘ladder’ (the verb via Old French escaler or medieval Latin scalare ‘climb’), from the base of Latin scandere ‘to climb’

definitions: a graduated range of values forming a standard system for measuring or grading something

examples.text: company employees have hit the top of their pay scales

shortDefinitions: graduated range of values forming standard system for measuring or grading something

definitions: the full range of different levels of people or things, from lowest to highest

examples.text: two men at opposite ends of the social scale

shortDefinitions: full range of different levels of people or things, from lowest to

definitions: a series of marks at regular intervals in a line used in measuring something

examples.text: the mean delivery time is plotted against a scale on the right

shortDefinitions: series of marks at regular intervals in line

definitions: a device having a series of marks at regular intervals in a line used in measuring something

examples.text: she read the exact distance off a scale

shortDefinitions: device having series of marks at regular intervals for measuring

definitions: a rule determining the distances between marks on a scale

examples.text: the vertical axis is given on a logarithmic scale

shortDefinitions: rule determining distances between marks on scale

definitions: the relative size or extent of something

examples.text: no one foresaw the scale of the disaster
everything in the house is on a grand scale

shortDefinitions: relative size or extent of something

definitions: a ratio of size in a map, model, drawing, or plan

examples.text: a one-fifth scale model of a seven-story building
a map on a scale of 1:2500

shortDefinitions: ratio of size in map, model or plan

definitions: an arrangement of the notes in any system of music in ascending or descending order of pitch

examples.text: the scale of C major

shortDefinitions: arrangement of notes in any system of music

definitions: the exercise of performing the notes of one or more scales as a form of practice by a singer or musician

examples.text: in music class I dread having to sing scales
he thinks guitarists in particular don't spend nearly enough time practicing scales

shortDefinitions: exercise of performing notes of scales

definitions: a system of numerical notation in which the value of a digit depends upon its position in the number, successive positions representing successive powers of a fixed base

examples.text: the conversion of the number to the binary scale

shortDefinitions: system of numerical notation in which value of digit depends upon its position in number

definitions: the range of exposures over which a photographic material will give an acceptable variation in density.
shortDefinitions: range of exposures over which photographic material will give acceptable variation in density

definitions: climb up or over (something high and steep)

examples.text: thieves scaled an 8-foot fence

shortDefinitions: climb up or over

definitions: represent in proportional dimensions; reduce or increase in size according to a common scale.
shortDefinitions: represent in proportional dimensions

definitions: (of a quantity or property) be variable according to a particular scale.
shortDefinitions: (of quantity or property) be variable according to particular scale

definitions: estimate the amount of timber that will be produced from (a log or uncut tree)

examples.text: the operators were accustomed to having their logs scaled for inventory control

shortDefinitions: estimate amount of timber that will be produced from
